org.threadly.concurrent
Class SynchronizedDynamicDelayQueue<T extends java.util.concurrent.Delayed>

java.lang.Object
  org.threadly.concurrent.SynchronizedDynamicDelayQueue<T>
Type Parameters:
T - Parameter to indicate what type of item is contained in the queue
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Iterable<T>, java.util.Collection<T>, java.util.Queue<T>, DynamicDelayQueue<T>
public class SynchronizedDynamicDelayQueue<T extends java.util.concurrent.Delayed>
extends java.lang.Object
implements DynamicDelayQueue<T>

This is a DynamicDelayQueue that is thread safe by strict usage of synchronization.

Constructor Detail

SynchronizedDynamicDelayQueue

public SynchronizedDynamicDelayQueue()
Constructs a new queue

SynchronizedDynamicDelayQueue

public SynchronizedDynamicDelayQueue(VirtualLock queueLock)
Constructs a queue, providing the lock that will be called on with .await(). Thus it allows you to synchronize around the .take() and have the lock released while the thread blocks.

Parameters:
queueLock - lock that is used internally
Method Detail

getLock

public java.lang.Object getLock()
Description copied from interface: DynamicDelayQueue
Returns the object that will be called with .wait during .wait. And must be synchronized on while using the iterator.

Specified by:
getLock in interface DynamicDelayQueue<T extends java.util.concurrent.Delayed>
Returns:
object synchronized on internally

sortQueue

public void sortQueue()
Description copied from interface: DynamicDelayQueue
Does a full sort on the queue, this is usually not optimal. It is better to call reposition(T e), but this could be used if many items moved at the same time.

Specified by:
sortQueue in interface DynamicDelayQueue<T extends java.util.concurrent.Delayed>

reposition

public void reposition(T e)
Description copied from interface: DynamicDelayQueue
Called to reposition an item in the queue which's delay has updated since original insertion (or was originally inserted as addLast().

Specified by:
reposition in interface DynamicDelayQueue<T extends java.util.concurrent.Delayed>
Parameters:

addLast

public void addLast(T e)
Description copied from interface: DynamicDelayQueue
Adds an item to the end of the queue, used as an optimization from add(T e) when it is known the item will be at the end of the queue

Specified by:
